reasoning.correctness: Gold Answer details precise chronology: sore throat Day 1 (worsening over 4 days), muscle aches/fatigue shortly after, taste Day 3 (constant, new), breathing Day 4 (constant, worsening, new). Generated Answer correctly identifies sore throat onset 4 days ago and partial severity, vaguely notes new/worsening yesterday (breathing), mentions aches and taste but assigns them to 'current status' without correct timings; misses explicit worsening trajectories, fatigue distinction, self-treatment failure, and overall progression; significant factual errors in symptom timelines and severity changes.
reasoning.completeness: Key points from Gold: sore throat onset/worsening/swallowing (covered partially), aches/fatigue timing/details (missed timing, partial mention), taste timing/details/no smell loss (missed timing/details), breathing details (vague partial), self-treatment (missed), progressive trajectory (missed). Covers sore throat ~50%, breathing vaguely, aches/taste minimally; ~20-49% coverage.
reasoning.faithfulness: All cited claims verifiable: sore throat/swallowing [P-2], concerned [P-8], aches [P-25], taste/smell [P-19]; inference 'likely difficulty breathing' grounded in explicit [P-7/P-8]; minor interpretive vagueness on 'new symptom or worsening' and COVID context [D-43], but no hallucinations; mostly grounded.
reasoning.relevance: Directly attempts chronological symptom order and severity (sore throat onset, yesterday worsening, current symptoms), but incomplete chronology, missing severity changes for most symptoms, and inaccurate groupings; partially addresses question without off-topic content.

summary: The Generated Answer partially captures symptom onset but fails in accurate chronology, detailed severity changes, and coverage of all key points from the Gold Answer, resulting in low correctness and completeness.
